comment.author: 63085612@N00
comment._content: The label on this one should be changed to "in the 1940s". The vehicles depicted range from the late '20s to the very early '40s. The two-tone Chevy fastback (fifth from the right, in center of street) is the clearest indication of the date of this photo. It is a style introduced for the 1941 model year. While it was continued postwar into 1948 I see nothing that would clearly support a theory that this was either during the war or shortly thereafter. Gasoline was severely rationed and tires were virtually unavailable during the war. This virtually curtailed private vehicle usage. Thus I would think that this photo was most likely taken within the year preceding Pearl Harbor! [ via Keene and Cheshire County (NH) Historical Photos's tag 'automobiles' on flickriver  --jamu98765 ]

comment.realname: Keene Public Library and the Historical Society of Cheshire County
comment.author: 25960495@N06
comment._content: Thanks again for the info. I'll adjust the dates accordingly.
